intro: Veronica subsessilis var. ibukiensis, commonly known as the Ibukiensis speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its compact growth habit. This variety is of interest to botanists and gardeners due to its ornamental value and limited distribution.
